articles.headline: Air Force, Running Low on Drone Pilots, Turns to Contractors in Terror Fight
articles.snippet: The Pentagon is increasingly relying on private contractors to operate drones for reconnaissance missions in Afghanistan and Iraq.
articles.abstract: The Pentagon is increasingly relying on private contractors to operate drones for reconnaissance missions in Afghanistan and Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The American military’s extensive use of drones against the Islamic State and other terrorist groups has resulted in a shortage of Air Force pilots and other personnel to operate the aircraft, leading the Pentagon to rely more on private contractors for reconnaissance missions in Afghanistan and Iraq.

articles.headline: BuzzFeed Regroups as Media Turns Video-Centric
articles.snippet: A reorganization emphasizes video and entertainment to generate revenue, but executives say the company remains committed to its news operations.
articles.abstract: A reorganization emphasizes video and entertainment to generate revenue, but executives say the company remains committed to its news operations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Staff meetings at BuzzFeed are not uncommon. Jonah H. Peretti, the site’s founder and chief executive, who is based in Los Angeles, travels to the New York offices regularly and often meets with employees to answer questions or outline strategy.

articles.headline: Why Airgas Was Finally Sold, for $10 Billion Instead of $5 Billion
articles.snippet: After a bitter battle with a rival intent on taking over the company he founded, Peter McCausland grew tired of fighting big shareholders.
articles.abstract: After a bitter battle with a rival intent on taking over the company he founded, Peter McCausland grew tired of fighting big shareholders.
articles.lead_paragraph: Big shareholders do not always play nice.

articles.headline: No ‘For Sale’ Sign? Silicon Valley Buyers Aren’t Deterred
articles.snippet: So few homes are on the market that buyers are getting more aggressive and innovative in approaching owners who haven’t officially decided to sell.
articles.abstract: So few homes are on the market that buyers are getting more aggressive and innovative in approaching owners who haven’t officially decided to sell.
articles.lead_paragraph: REDWOOD CITY, Calif. — Swell-looking home you’ve got here. Ever think about selling it? How about to me, right now?

articles.headline: Phyllis Schlafly, ‘First Lady’ of a Political March to the Right, Dies at 92
articles.snippet: Angered by the cultural transformations of the 1960s, Mrs. Schlafly led grass-roots campaigns against Communism, abortion and the Equal Rights Amendment.
articles.abstract: Angered by the cultural transformations of the 1960s, Mrs. Schlafly led grass-roots campaigns against Communism, abortion and the Equal Rights Amendment.
articles.lead_paragraph: Phyllis Schlafly, whose grass-roots campaigns against Communism, abortion and the Equal Rights Amendment galvanized conservatives for almost two generations and helped reshape American politics, died on Monday. She was 92.

articles.headline: Whom to Vote For? Employees Tend to Follow Their Leader
articles.snippet: A chief executive’s political leanings may significantly influence whom workers donate to and choose at the polls, a study found.
articles.abstract: A chief executive’s political leanings may significantly influence whom workers donate to and choose at the polls, a study found.
articles.lead_paragraph: Late last month, Tim Cook, Apple’s chief executive, hosted a private fund-raiser for Hillary Clinton in Los Altos, Calif., along with his colleague Lisa Jackson, vice president of Apple’s environmental, policy and social initiatives. The private, off-the-record event required a donation of $2,700 to $50,000.

articles.headline: Subprime Lender, Busy at State Level, Avoids Federal Scrutiny
articles.snippet: OneMain Financial, the nation’s largest subprime installment lender, has not weighed in on proposed federal rules, but it has lobbied several states.
articles.abstract: OneMain Financial, the nation’s largest subprime installment lender, has not weighed in on proposed federal rules, but it has lobbied several states.
articles.lead_paragraph: The payday lending industry is bracing for a regulatory crackdown. One of its rivals is not.

articles.headline: Fox Settles With Gretchen Carlson Over Roger Ailes Sex Harassment Claims
articles.snippet: In a separate development, Fox News announced that Greta Van Susteren was leaving the network, effective immediately.
articles.abstract: In a separate development, Fox News announced that Greta Van Susteren was leaving the network, effective immediately.
articles.lead_paragraph: Fox News’s parent company spent $20 million on Tuesday to settle a lawsuit brought by a former anchor, Gretchen Carlson, whose allegations of sexual harassment toppled the network’s powerful chairman, Roger Ailes, and engulfed the company in crisis.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin

articles.headline: Driscoll’s Aims to Hook the Berry-Buying Shopper
articles.snippet: The company plans a new marketing campaign intended to place it in the company of other big fruit brands like Dole and Chiquita.
articles.abstract: The company plans a new marketing campaign intended to place it in the company of other big fruit brands like Dole and Chiquita.
articles.lead_paragraph: WATSONVILLE, Calif. — On 40 acres at a farm near the central coast of California, new varieties of strawberries, raspberries, blackberries and blueberries are being tested, each of them proprietary. No other company in the world grows berries exactly like these.

articles.headline: Campuses Cautiously Train Freshmen Against Subtle Insults
articles.snippet: Many orientation programs now cover “microaggressions” in addition to addressing issues of diversity and sexual consent.
articles.abstract: Many orientation programs now cover “microaggressions” in addition to addressing issues of diversity and sexual consent.
articles.lead_paragraph: WORCESTER, Mass. — A freshman tentatively raises her hand and takes the microphone. “I’m really scared to ask this,” she begins. “When I, as a white female, listen to music that uses the N word, and I’m in the car, or, especially when I’m with all white friends, is it O.K. to sing along?”
